body:
So just today my minecraft started crashing for no reason. I will play and it just crashes for no reason. I looked at the crash log and this is what it says...

#
# A fatal error has been detected by the Java Runtime Environment:
#
#  EXCEPTION_ACCESS_VIOLATION (0xc0000005) at pc=0x000000018000580b, pid=9952, tid=7608
#
# JRE version: Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (8.0_25-b18) (build 1.8.0_25-b18)
# Java VM: Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (25.25-b02 mixed mode windows-amd64 compressed oops)
# Problematic frame:
# C  [HMIPCore64.dll+0x580b]
#
# Failed to write core dump. Minidumps are not enabled by default on client versions of Windows
#
# An error report file with more information is saved as:
# C:\Users\mhani_000\AppData\Roaming\.minecraft\hs_err_pid9952.log
#
# If you would like to submit a bug report, please visit:
#   http://bugreport.sun.com/bugreport/crash.jsp
# The crash happened outside the Java Virtual Machine in native code.
# See problematic frame for where to report the bug.
#
AL lib: (EE) alc_cleanup: 1 device not closed
Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM warning: Using incremental CMS is deprecated and will likely be removed in a future release


I have no idea what is going on whatsoever. I tried to do a system restore, update my java, and reinstall minecraft, but it doesn't work :/ It doesn't work on 1.8 labbymod, 1.9 labbymod, 1.8 forge or vanilla. 
Here is the entire log on paste bin if anyone could please help :c
http://pastebin.com/mCKKzp7e

Here is the entire log on paste bin if anyone could please help :c
http://pastebin.com/mCKKzp7e
title: Minecraft crashing help!!

replies.body:
It's connected to your java version, at least it doesn't look like a normal minecraft crash report.

Things you could do:
- Turn the computer off and on again.
- Updating your graphics drivers
- Updating your JRE (Java Runtime Environment)

After some research most likely your graphics drivers are not updated.
replies.body_tagged:
It's connected to your java version, at least it doesn't look like a normal minecraft crash report.

Things you could do:
- Turn the computer off and on again.
- Updating your graphics drivers
- Updating your JRE (Java Runtime Environment)

After some research most likely your graphics drivers are not updated.

replies.body: Check that you're using the correct Java version for your MC launcher. Also, check that you don't have two versions that conflict.
replies.body_tagged: Check that you're using the correct Java version for your MC launcher. Also, check that you don't have two versions that conflict.

replies.body_tagged:

replies.body: Minecraft doesn't use the full version of Java anymore, instead it is built in to Minecraft itself. If Minecraft is the only thing you use Java for, uninstall it, as it has been known to cause problems in the past.
replies.body_tagged: Minecraft doesn't use the full version of Java anymore, instead it is built in to Minecraft itself. If Minecraft is the only thing you use Java for, uninstall it, as it has been known to cause problems in the past.

reply_to.body: Check that you're using the correct Java version for your MC launcher. Also, check that you don't have two versions that conflict.
reply_to.body_tagged: Check that you're using the correct Java version for your MC launcher. Also, check that you don't have two versions that conflict.

replies.body: Ah, so now this version of Java I have can be un-installed. thanks. =)

replies.body:
Go to visual settings on Minecraft and turn on both VSync and VBOs

I had the same exact problem for a while and when I did this everything was fixed
replies.body_tagged:
Go to visual settings on Minecraft and turn on both VSync and VBOs

I had the same exact problem for a while and when I did this everything was fixed

replies.body: I don't have much experience with Java errors, even though I do develop Java programs and spigot plugins. To me, this issue seems as it's been caused due to lack of memory needed for a thread or the Java virtual machine. I might be wrong, but that's what it looks like to me. How many gigabytes of ram does your computer have?

replies.body: A GeForce 210. But here's the thing. I just tried to run minecraft on my mom's work laptop and it ran pretty well but the same exact error came up. Minecraft crashed on that computer too as frequently as it did on this one. This problem started happening all of a sudden and the only thing I can think of is a software that I downloaded. I installed "Hide My Ip" to my desktop and my mom's laptop the day before minecraft started to show these errors. After i installed this software the crashing started, and considering that the same problem is happening on my mom's computer I think that is what is causing it. Unfortunately, even though I removed the software from both computers, the problem persists. Aslo, neither one of the two computers has a restore point set to before I downloaded hide my IP. I know it sounds ridiculous that a ip changer might be causing this mess but I hope that this info helps out :c Thanks for your help <3
replies.body_tagged: A GeForce 210. But here's the thing. I just tried to run minecraft on my mom's work laptop and it ran pretty well but the same exact error came up. Minecraft crashed on that computer too as frequently as it did on this one. This problem started happening all of a sudden and the only thing I can think of is a software that I downloaded. I installed "Hide My Ip" to my desktop and my mom's laptop the day before minecraft started to show these errors. After i installed this software the crashing started, and considering that the same problem is happening on my mom's computer I think that is what is causing it. Unfortunately, even though I removed the software from both computers, the problem persists. Aslo, neither one of the two computers has a restore point set to before I downloaded hide my IP. I know it sounds ridiculous that a ip changer might be causing this mess but I hope that this info helps out :c Thanks for your help <3

replies.body: Okay so I found a semi solution to this problem. For some reason the crashes were not happening on 1.7 or 1.8 vanilla. So I decided to try out some other mods. As a replacement for toggle sneak and optifine I used Tazz's MTRL mod. Thankfully no crashes have happened and everything is working fine :) Just wanted to post this solution in case anyone else had this problem.
replies.body_tagged: Okay so I found a semi solution to this problem. For some reason the crashes were not happening on 1.7 or 1.8 vanilla. So I decided to try out some other mods. As a replacement for toggle sneak and optifine I used Tazz's MTRL mod. Thankfully no crashes have happened and everything is working fine :) Just wanted to post this solution in case anyone else had this problem.
